description:
Verify that a user can share a task using the available sharing options (link, QR code, calendar) and that the shareable link is generated and copied as expected.

Open the app and identify a task you want to share from the task list.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") on the selected task.
Select the "Share" option from the dropdown menu.
In the share dialog, review the available share options (e.g., Link, QR Code, Calendar).
Click "Copy" to copy the shareable link, or select another share method if desired.
Observe the confirmation message (such as "Copied link to clipboard") and verify the link content if pasted elsewhere.

steps.stepDescription: Open a browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173
Locate and select a task from the task list to be shared
Click on the three-dot menu associated with the chosen task
Choose the Share option from the dropdown menu
In the share dialog, review the available share options such as Link, QR Code, and Calendar
Copy the shareable link by clicking the Copy button or choose an alternative share method if desired
Verify that a confirmation message such as 'Copied link to clipboard' is displayed
Optionally paste the copied link to confirm that the correct URL is generated
Take a screenshot of the completed share operation to ensure the test outcome

description:
Verify that a user can generate and download a QR code to share a task.

Open the app and locate the task you want to share.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") next to the task.
Select "Share" from the dropdown menu to open the share dialog.
Click the "QR CODE" tab within the share options.
Confirm a QR code is generated and visible on the dialog.
Click the "DOWNLOAD QR CODE" button to save the QR code image.
Optionally, scan the QR code with a QR code reader to validate it directs to the correct task details or shareable link.
testname: Share Task Via QR Code and Download QR Code

steps.stepDescription: Open the web application by navigating to http://localhost:5173
Locate the task you want to share within the application interface
Identify and click the three-dot menu next to the selected task
From the dropdown menu, select the 'Share' option to open the share dialog
Within the share dialog, switch to the 'QR CODE' tab to display the QR code generator
Verify that a QR code is generated and visible in the share dialog
Click the 'DOWNLOAD QR CODE' button to save the QR code image to your device
Optionally, scan the downloaded QR code with a QR code reader to validate it directs to the correct task details
Take a final screenshot of the completed task sharing process to document the successful generation and download of the QR code

description:
Verify that a user can export a task to an external calendar (e.g., Apple Calendar) using the share dialog's calendar feature.

Open the app and find the task you want to export to a calendar.
Click the three-dot menu ("...") for that task.
Select "Share" to open the share dialog.
Click the "CALENDAR" tab in the share options.
Click the "Add to Apple Calendar" (or relevant calendar app) button.
Observe the calendar file (.ics) downloads automatically.
Open the .ics file and check that the event details match the task's title, description, and deadline.

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173/
Locate the task you want to export in the application interface.
Access the options for the task by clicking the three-dot menu for that task.
Open the share dialog by selecting the Share option from the menu.
Switch to the CALENDAR tab within the share options of the dialog.
Click the Add to Apple Calendar button (or the corresponding calendar app button) in the share dialog.
Observe that the .ics file downloads automatically upon clicking the calendar export option.
Open the downloaded .ics file to review the event details.
Verify that the event details in the .ics file match the task’s title, description, and deadline.
Capture a screenshot of the completed task export to confirm the successful execution of the test.
